Instruction: This recipe guarantees a baked potato that is crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, satisfying your quest for the ideal baked potato.

Whip up this easy recipe for a delightful treat that's the perfect combination of crispy and fluffy! It's made with basic ingredients you likely have in your pantry. Save this recipe for gatherings, cookouts, or even weeknight meals!

Begin by washing and scrubbing the potatoes. Next, use a fork or knife to pierce each potato to allow steam to escape during baking. Apply olive oil to coat the potatoes, either by rubbing it all over the skin with your hands or by placing the potatoes and oil in a zip-top bag and shaking to distribute the oil. Lastly, season the potatoes with salt.
Bake the potatoes in a 300 degree F oven until they are tender and turn golden brown, for approximately 90 minutes.
Slice into the tender potatoes and fluff the interior. Add toppings such as black pepper, butter, Cheddar cheese, chives, sour cream, or any other garnishes of your choice.
The baking time for baked potatoes may vary based on the size of the potatoes, typically ranging between 50 minutes to 1 ½ hours.
You'll know the baked potato is ready when a fork easily pierces through the skin. If it's still firm in the middle, continue baking for a bit longer.
When unsure about the doneness of the baked potatoes, you can use a digital thermometer to check if they have reached an internal temperature of 210 degrees Fahrenheit.
